newsitem.title: FRANCE: Havas, Gle des Eaux bid for SFP.
newsitem.headline: Havas, Gle des Eaux bid for SFP.

text.p: French media giant Havas and utility Compagnie Generale des Eaux said on Tuesday they would launch a joint bid for film production company SFP.
"Group Havas and Groupe Generale des Eaux have decided...to submit a joint 50-50 offer," the companies said in a statement.

The companies said in a statement that they would "achieve the synergies between the two groups and SFP" via their two respective majority-held audio-visual subsidiaries, ITT/Tele Images and Generale d'Images.
ITI/Tele Images is a production company belonging to Groupe Havas while Generale d'Images belongs to Generale des Eaux.
"The two groups are, as a result of their links and their involvement in the audio-visual sector, in a position to put into effect a long-lasting industrial project."
They gave no financial details about their offer for Societe Francaise de Production (SFP) which is being privatised by the government.
